title: Amtrak Blamed for Cost Overruns for New York's Moynihan Station
summary: Station might not open on schedule, inspector general tells Congress. Amtrak is more than two-thirds over its initial $106 million budget for the Moynihan Train Hall project in New York City, a new report finds, and early missteps raise doubts that the new facility will be able to open to customers by the end of 2020 as planned.

title: Target Posts Record Growth as Pandemic Fuels E-Commerce
summary: Retailer's online sales nearly tripled in latest quarter; Lowe's also among the winners as consumers spent more on home improvement. The coronavirus pandemic has widened the gap between retail's winners and losers, boosting the fortunes of big U.S. chains that were able to stay open throughout the pandemic and feed America's basic needs.

title: Airbnb Files Confidentially for IPO With SEC
summary: Home-sharing giant's plans to go public are a surprise turnaround after pandemic hurt bookings. Airbnb Inc. said Wednesday it confidentially filed paperwork with the Securities and Exchange Commission for an initial public offering, marking a surprising turnaround for a company whose business was initially ravaged by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: California's Green Blackouts
summary: If you eliminate fossil fuels, power shortages are inevitable.. Millions of Californians have lost power in recent days amid a brutal heat wave, and state regulators warn of more outages in the days and perhaps years to come. Welcome to California's green new normal, a harbinger of a fossil-free world.

title: The Russian Grassy Knoll
summary: The collusion conspiracy theorists keep looking for a second shooter.. By now you'd think promoters of the Russia-Trump 2016 collusion myth would give up from embarrassment, but they've become like believers in the second JFK shooter on the grassy knoll. Note how they spin the lack of evidence in the Senate Intelligence Committee's final report into a reprise of false accusations.

title: Venezuela's Human Bargaining Chips
summary: Some 800 Americans are forbidden to leave the country.. The Castro regime in Cuba has a long history of using political prisoners to negotiate with the civilized world-for sanctions relief, financial aid, or the release of convicted spies. Now Venezuela may be getting into the act by refusing to let more than 800 Americans leave the country.

title: Bayern Munich Cruises Into Champions League Final
summary: The German juggernaut easily handles Lyon, setting up a Sunday clash with Paris Saint-Germain, a heavy underdog. When the final whistle came, the Lyon players couldn't help but shrug-and not just because they were French. There was nothing else to do. Lyon, France's seventh-place team, had run up against a juggernaut from Germany in the Champions League semifinal.

title: Kamala Harris and the Anarchists
summary: Why would a former proud 'top cop' characterize Portland demonstrators as 'mothers and veterans'?. Sen. Kamala Harris recently upbraided acting Homeland Security Secretary Chad Wolf for using "chemical agents" like tear gas against what she described as "mothers and veterans" protesting in Portland, Ore. "I would advise you," Ms. Harris reproached him at an Aug. 6 hearing, "it is well known there are mothers, including pregnant women, attending these protests. I would advise you to consult with medical experts."

title: Why Would States Limit Hospital-Bed Supply?
summary: 'Certificate of need' laws proved deadly when the Covid pandemic struck.. The coronavirus pandemic is refuting the case for a common regulation of the medical industry. Thirty-five states and the District of Columbia require hospitals and other providers to obtain a "certificate of need" before they may buy major equipment, build new facilities, or expand their services. The assumption is that, absent such rules, there would be redundant medical services that could put existing providers out of business.

title: Joe Biden Revives the Four-Corners Offense
summary: Since March, he has tried to run out the clock. Will that change on Thursday night?. You might think the Biden campaign's masterminds are manager Jen O'Malley Dillon, chief strategist Mike Donilon, senior adviser Anita Dunn and communications director Kate Bedingfield, and you'd be right. But the team cribbed its battle plan from John McLendon.

title: After Tragedy in Beirut, End Lebanon's U.N. Farce
summary: The peacekeeping force fails to obstruct Hezbollah and block arms smuggling. The U.S. should rein it in.. The catastrophic blast in the port of Beirut this month has put proper scrutiny on Hezbollah, the Iranian proxy militia and terror group that controls much of Lebanon. But it also underscores the failings of the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon, known by the acronym Unifil, which is supposed to block arms smuggling. Dysfunctional and ineffective, the force does more harm than good. When Unifil's mandate comes up for renewal at the Security Council on Aug. 31, the U.S. should try to reduce the size of the force or end the mission altogether.

title: The Postal Service Democrats
summary: Forget the sturdy Democratic donkey. Nancy Pelosi has changed her party's logo to a post office.. An eon ago, Nancy Pelosi entered national politics as the host committee chairwoman of the 1984 Democratic National Convention in San Francisco. Other than sending former Vice President Walter Mondale to defeat by Ronald Reagan (Mr. Mondale carried one state, his own, plus the District of Columbia), the convention survives in memory only for being branded by Jeane Kirkpatrick at the Republican convention as "the San Francisco Democrats." Never has so much political derision filled eight syllables as "the San Francisco Democrats."

title: 'Promised Land' Review: A Short-Lived Consensus
summary: World War II engendered a shared middle-class culture that permeated America and reduced the distance between rich and poor.. David Stebenne's "Promised Land: How the Rise of the Middle Class Transformed America, 1929-1968" invites us to remember those decades in which both the middle class and the Democratic Party were ascendant. Mr. Stebenne, a professor of history at the Ohio State University, offers more warning than nostalgia, for his lesson is that "the rise of the middle class, and the growth of the mechanisms that powered it, eventually undermined the stability of that achievement." Nemesis stalked the suburban tract homes of 1958.

title: Crackdown on Gun Crime Has Brought 1,400 Arrests So Far
summary: Operation Legend has sent federal agents to nine cities this summer. Federal agents deployed to U.S. cities to help crackdown on gun violence have made more than 1,400 arrests in roughly a month, Attorney General William Barr said Wednesday.

title: Trump Calls for Goodyear Boycott Over Ban on Campaign Attire
summary: President discourages purchasing from tire maker in latest incident posing challenge for business leaders' efforts to regulate workplace political speech. President Trump called for a boycott of Goodyear Tire & Rubber Co. in response to reports that the company showed a slide to workers prohibiting the wearing of politically affiliated slogans, such as "Make America Great Again" apparel.

title: Scotiabank Fined $127 Million for Price Manipulation, False Statements
summary: Settlement concerns manipulative orders for precious metals futures contracts and was compounded by compliance failures, Justice Department and CFTC say. The Bank of Nova Scotia agreed to pay more than $127 million to settle civil and criminal allegations in connection with its role in what authorities described as a massive price-manipulation scheme.

title: Nvidia Posts Record Sales as Pandemic Sustains Chip Demand
summary: Chip maker's shares have surged during health crisis, making it best performing stock in the S&P 500. Graphic-chip maker Nvidia Corp. continued its run of strong financial performance during the coronavirus pandemic, posting record sales in the latest quarter propelled by strong demand for online gaming and remote computing services.

title: Political Conventions Went Stale Before They Went Virtual
summary: Quadrennial floor fights once inspired lifetimes spent in politics, but the parties have long preferred tight, TV-friendly scripting to conflict and chaos. Forty years ago this summer, I walked onto the floor of the Republican National Convention in Detroit as an analyst for CBS News. For someone who had been mesmerized since childhood by the drama of American political conventions, it was like being invited to pitch the opening game of the World Series after a couple of decades of Little League play.

title: U.S. Won't Pursue Death Penalty Against Two Islamic Militants, Justice Department Tells British
summary: Move could open door for U.K. to send evidence on the pair to U.S., facilitating prosecution. The Justice Department has told the British government it will not pursue the death penalty against a pair of Islamic State militants accused in the torture and killing of Western hostages, a change in posture that could clear a path for their prosecution in the U.S.

title: Fed Sees Need for Additional Support but Is Vague on Timing
summary: Minutes from July meeting show officials are close to finalizing a revamp of their long-run policy-setting approach. Federal Reserve officials said at their meeting last month they expected the economy would require greater government support to recover from the coronavirus pandemic, though they didn't signal at which of their coming meetings they would deploy those tools.

title: New Jersey Supreme Court Curbs Power of Newark's Police Oversight Board
summary: Justices strip board of authority to issue subpoenas during investigations of officer misconduct. The New Jersey Supreme Court ruled that the investigative powers of Newark's civilian-complaint review board were too broad, dealing a blow to advocates calling for greater police accountability.

title: John Kerry's Fantasy World
summary: Reality differs starkly from his telling of the Obama years.. Convention speeches usually aren't bound by accuracy, but sometimes they are so false they require a comment. So it is with former Secretary of State John Kerry's claim that President Trump inherited "a more peaceful world" and "bankrupted it."

title: John Ford's First Rodeos
summary: Universal Pictures and Kino Lorber issue gleaming and immersive editions of two of the director's early, silent westerns..

title: Company Write-Downs Surge as Business Slows During Covid-19
summary: U.S. companies booked roughly $261 billion in impairment charges in the first half, more than the total in all of 2019. U.S. companies are writing down more of their assets during the coronavirus pandemic than they have in years.

title: New U.S. Covid-19 Cases Jump as Fears Grow Over Campus Spread
summary: Colleges pivot as U.S. reports more than 44,000 new cases; Michigan State, Notre Dame among those switching plans. The number of new coronavirus cases in the U.S. climbed but remained below 50,000 for the fourth day in a row, as some universities and schools moved classes online to avoid campus outbreaks.

title: Postal Delivery Delays Trouble E-Commerce Sellers
summary: Marketplace eBay says it is looking at 'more reliable delivery options' for its small merchants. U.S. Postal Service package-delivery delays are causing headaches for e-commerce sellers and prompting digital marketplace eBay Inc. to look for alternatives as heavy online demand taxes domestic parcel networks.

title: The Latest Pain Trade on Wall Street: Banks
summary: Hedge funds that invest in banks are posting double-digit losses, and some are shutting down. Hedge fund M3 Partners of Salt Lake City notched its best returns during the financial crisis, gaining more than 32% in 2008 and 2009. This year has been a different story.

title: U.S. Stocks Slip After S&P 500's Record Close
summary: Stocks lost momentum after the Fed minutes showed officials grappled with how to spur growth. U.S. stocks edged lower Wednesday, a day after the S&P 500 set its first record close since February, after Federal Reserve officials highlighted the uncertainties facing the economy.

title: Apple Surges to $2 Trillion Market Value
summary: Tech stock has more than doubled from its March 23 low amid better-than-expected iPhone results. Apple Inc. on Wednesday became the first U.S. public company to eclipse $2 trillion in market value, a dizzying achievement that highlights the iPhone maker's commanding role in the world economy.

title: Next Steps on Coronavirus Stimulus Divide Both Parties
summary: Senate GOP leaders are trying to rally support for a new, smaller aid bill, while some House Democrats want to vote this weekend on extending unemployment benefits. WASHINGTON-Lawmakers from both parties are growing increasingly worried by the stalemate over a coronavirus aid package, but internal divisions on each side are complicating their efforts to propose new measures.

title: Offshore Drilling Contractor Valaris Files for Bankruptcy in the U.S.
summary: London-based offshore drilling contractor said it has a proposed $6.5 billion deal to turn over ownership mostly to lenders and bondholders. Valaris PLC , a London-based offshore drilling contractor, filed for bankruptcy Wednesday in the U.S. with a proposed $6.5 billion debt-for-equity swap that hands over ownership of most of the company to creditors.

title: Joe Biden's Aviators: A Fashion (and Political) Statement
summary: For years, democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden's Ray-Ban sunglasses have been his sartorial signature. At the Democratic National Convention they're a part of his campaign too.. AS THE FOCUS shifted to Louisiana during the roll-call portion of last night's Democratic National Convention, viewers could spot a young boy standing at stage right holding a sign showing a pair of aviator sunglasses-shorthand for Joe Biden. Metal-rimmed aviators have been a sartorial signature of the Democratic presidential candidate since well before that young boy was even born. The 77-year-old former vice president told the Skimm newsletter in 2016 that he's been sporting aviators since he "was a freshman in college as a lifeguard." Today, his Twitter bio reads, in part, "Loves ice cream, aviators & @Amtrak."

title: Traders Accused of Market Manipulation Allege Misconduct by Prosecutors
summary: Traders asked court to order prosecutor to search Justice Department files for evidence that could be exculpatory.. WASHINGTON -- Lawyers for Bank of America Corp. wrote last year that prosecutors had warned the bank against doing its own analysis of potentially manipulative trading out of concern the findings could contradict the government's investigation.

title: Wildfires Tear Across California
summary: Blazes force evacuations, threaten homes in northern part of state.

title: After Mali Coup, Mutineers Pledge Fresh Elections
summary: A strategically important U.S. ally, Mali faces a crisis after the resignation of President Ibrahim Boubacar Keita. JOHANNESBURG-Military officers who led a coup in Mali that forced the resignation of President Ibrahim Boubacar Keita revealed themselves Wednesday, pledging to quickly organize fresh elections and tame the twin political and security crises that have gripped this strategically vital West African nation.

title: Retailers See E-Commerce Investments Pay Off Big as Coronavirus Keeps Shoppers Home
summary: Online sales are expected to break records this year as consumers avoid in-person browsing, a shift expected to outlast the pandemic. Retailers from Home Depot Inc. to Nestlé SA and AutoNation Inc. have accelerated their e-commerce efforts to keep up with a rush to online shopping impelled by coronavirus precautions.

title: Apple at $2 Trillion Leaves No Room for Error
summary: Milestone brings record valuation just as the key App Store business model comes under attack. Apple Inc. became a $2 trillion company on Wednesday. The irony is this shows just how little it can afford to lose.

title: Fund's Woes Highlight Risks Lurking in Commodity ETFs
summary: Securities regulators are zeroing in on fund's overhaul after oil crashed earlier this year. Securities regulators have warned the largest U.S. crude-oil exchange-traded fund that it could face enforcement action related to its overhaul after oil crashed earlier this year, the latest development illustrating the dangers of trading complex commodity products.

title: New York Teachers Union Threatens Strike if Schools Reopen Without Safety Measures
summary: The nation's largest school district's plans to open for in-person school on Sept. 10 face a fresh challenge. The president of the New York City teachers union said Wednesday that he doubts all school buildings will be able to safely reopen on time and threatened that the union would go to court and strike if necessary to protect staff and students.

title: Publisher's Report and Objective Journalism
summary: At this time in our nation's history, it is crucial that the Journal uphold its standards.. Regarding publisher Almar Latour's "A Report to Our Readers" (Aug. 12): I have observed with sadness the decline and fall of journalistic standards in many once-great periodicals. Editorializing in news stories isn't new, but it is always regrettable and used to be universally condemned. Holding editorial-page writers hostage to the vagaries of political trends and fashions, however, is a chilling new development. If opinion, which is by definition subjective and is meant to spark debate, can be censored or neutered so easily, one shudders to think of what happens to inconvenient facts that should appear in news stories.

title: There's Little Democratic Center Left to Hold
summary: William A. Galston is dreaming. The Democratic Party is solidly under leftist control.. William A. Galston outlines a number of societal ills that "most Democrats" seek to address: stilted capitalism, declining social mobility, distorted access to the fruits of a prosperous economy, corporate concentration, lack of societal inclusiveness, environmental problems, overly aggressive foreign policy and more ("Democrats Move Left, but the Center Holds," op-ed, Aug. 15).

title: 'Sam Gilliam' Review: Flowing Color, Billowing Canvas
summary: The artist's innovative, loosely draped work is a light and luminous addition to the galleries at Dia Beacon.. Beacon, N.Y.

title: 'Socialism Is Another Name for Disaster'
summary: A Florida congressional candidate could be a game-changer for limited government.. Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D., N.Y.) has been the most influential freshman lawmaker of the 116th Congress and perhaps of any modern Congress. Appearing Tuesday night on television's virtual Democratic National Convention, she managed to express fully her contempt for America and its history in just 96 seconds. Meanwhile in southwest Florida, a patriot who may be the most influential freshman of the 117th Congress took a big step toward the U.S. House.

title: A Medieval Manor West of London Lists for $6.55 Million
summary: Cothay Manor sits on 38.8 acres and includes a number of outbuildings and stables. For close to three decades, Mary-Anne Robb has devoted herself, body and soul, to Cothay Manor, a medieval house set in the English countryside.

title: Black Women Share Experiences of Discrimination in the Wine Industry
summary: Some of these women, who work in the industry, say they have experienced microaggressions or overt racism. WSJ columnist Lettie Teague, who is white, has always associated wine with feelings of conviviality and warmth, but Black women in the industry told her they have felt excluded and experienced microaggressions and overt racism on the job. Heather Johnston, who owns wine shop Good Wine in Brooklyn, and who is Black, said sales reps often assumed her white male employee was in charge. J'nai Gaither, who has worked as a tasting room associate at Napa Valley wineries, said one guest on a tour kept asking her about whether there was slavery in Napa. Others have felt comfortable using the 'N' word with her. A number of Black women in the industry say these aren't just one-off incidents and have pointed out other examples of inequity in the industry. Until recently, the Court of Master Sommeliers, a powerful industry organization, required students to call their instructors "master," a word widely associated with the history of slavery in the U.S.

title: A Medieval Manor in Modern Times
summary: Inside a 17,375-square-foot estate set in the English countryside.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: On The Grounds of Cothay Manor
summary: The 40-acre estate includes a number of outbuildings, stables and planted corridors.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: What to Watch: On Disney+ 'The One and Only Ivan,' a Star-Studded Live-Action Family Drama
summary: Also this week, HBO offers up a serial documentary about NXIVM, plus more picks to add to your queue. Binge-worthy documentaries have emerged as a popular genre of the streaming era, from "Making a Murderer" to "Wild Wild Country" (both on Netflix . ) This week, we offer two selections that are streaming this week, including one that is ripped from the headlines.

title: New York State Should Brace for Second Wave of Coronavirus Cases
summary: Gov. Andrew Cuomo says beginning of school year, flu season will pose challenges. Gov. Andrew Cuomo warned New York to prepare for a second wave of coronavirus cases, while officials said they found another uptick in cases in Brooklyn.

title: Copper Prices Rise Above $3 Amid Growth Hopes
summary: Prices extend rally driven by steady Chinese demand, supply disruptions. Copper rose above $3 a pound for the first time in more than two years on Wednesday, extending a recent rally driven by steady Chinese demand and disruptions to global supply.

title: Judge Rules Video of Robert Kraft in Massage Parlor Was Taken Illegally
summary: The New England Patriots owner and others were charged with misdemeanor counts of soliciting prostitution last year. An appeals court in Florida delivered a potentially crushing blow to the state's solicitation case against Robert Kraft, ruling that local police violated the constitutional rights of the New England Patriots owner and others with its video surveillance inside a massage parlor.

title: Uber and Lyft Threaten California Shutdown: Here's What's at Stake
summary: A key decision in the debate over how to classify drivers is expected this week, and the ramifications could be world-wide. Uber Technologies Inc. and Lyft Inc. have said they may suspend their ride-hailing operations in California as soon as Friday, escalating a high-stakes battle with their home state over how their drivers should be classified.

title: LeBron James and the Lakers Wear Modified MAGA Hats for Breonna Taylor
summary: Led by LeBron James, the Los Angeles Lakers collectively made a sartorial statement, calling to "Arrest the Cops Who Killed Breonna Taylor". THE LOS ANGELES Lakers all wore hats last night before taking on the Portland Trail Blazers in the NBA playoffs-hats that, superifically, looked like average "Make America Great Again" caps. On closer inspection of the caps, however, it became clear that half of President Donald Trump's campaign slogan had been crossed out, the fabric stitched with the words "Arrest the Cops Who Killed Breonna Taylor."

title: How Women's Suffrage Changed America Far Beyond the Ballot Box
summary: Resume Subscription. For American women, the battle for the right to vote was long and hard-fought, pitting three generations of suffragists against the nation's political and economic establishment. When the vote was finally won, with the ratification of the 19th Amendment in August 1920, many women looked forward to profound social change. The activist Maud Younger thought she was about to witness "the dawn of women's political power in America." Others had more modest expectations. "I did not expect any revolution when women got the ballot," recalled labor leader Rose Schneiderman, who rose to fame with her speech memorializing the victims of the 1911 Triangle Shirtwaist Fire in Manhattan. "But women needed the vote because they needed protection through the laws. Not having the vote, the lawmakers could ignore us." Ida B. Wells-Barnett, the Black journalist and activist, wished that her friends Frederick Douglass and Susan B. Anthony "could have been here to see the day when a woman's ballot will count equally with a man's."

title: It's Time to Update Your Boring Covid-Era Sneakers
summary: Yes, trainers make sense with your WFH uniform, but your gym shoes are not fashion, so consider one of these uplifting styles instead. IN THE PANDEMIC era, even those who once winced at the idea of wearing sneakers outside the gym have laced up with a shrug. What else is one to team with WFH sweatpants and a T-shirt when forced outside for a coffee-filter run? But just because you live in sneakers doesn't mean you should subject yourself or others to the same dull, creased, faded, fatigued, flabby, sigh-inducing athletic trainers again and again. Now that we're a solid five months into semi-isolation, consider the benefits of a stylish "sneaker wardrobe."

title: Senators Warn Trump Saudi-Chinese Uranium Plant Risks Spread of Nuclear Weapons
summary: Group of Democratic and Republican lawmakers request briefings on the matter, in letter to the president. WASHINGTON-A bipartisan group of U.S. senators warned President Trump on Wednesday that Saudi Arabia's undeclared nuclear and missile programs pose a serious threat to efforts to stop the spread of nuclear weapons in the region and requested briefings on the subject.

title: Long Power Outages After Isaias Spark Calls to Overhaul Utilities
summary: Officials order investigations, suggest breaking up big providers or making them publicly owned. Hurricane Isaias snapped trees, toppled power lines and knocked out electricity to more than two million households in the New York region, some for over a week. It also whipped up fresh anger against the area's large power utilities.

title: Citi Widens Hunt for Revlon Loan Payments
summary: Bank sues two more Revlon lenders that received full repayment on their loans last week and don't believe they were paid in error. Citigroup Inc. widened its effort to claw back money it wired to Revlon Inc. lenders, suing more investment firms that say they don't believe a major financial institution sent them portions of a $900 million payment by mistake.

title: Wary of Treading on Russia's Toes, Europe Plans Targeted Sanctions Against Belarus Officials
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin had warned EU against interfering in former Soviet Republic. Mindful of Russia's warning against interfering in Belarus, European Union leaders have taken a nuanced approach to the unfolding crisis, preparing sanctions against officials they say are responsible for rigging this month's presidential election and violently dispersing protesters, while emphasizing that only Belarusians can resolve the turmoil there.

title: Fundraising at Company Tied to Steve Bannon and Guo Wengui Faces Probe
summary: Former Trump political adviser and exiled Chinese businessman raised more than $300 million in private offering, Guo says. A media company linked to former Trump political adviser Steve Bannon and exiled Chinese businessman Guo Wengui raised more than $300 million in a private offering this spring that is now being investigated by federal and state authorities, say people familiar with the matter.

title: At Home Depot and Lowe's, Home-Improvement Splurge Can Go On
summary: The same factors propelling the housing market are boosting home-improvement retailers. Home-improvement retailers Home Depot and Lowe's had a phenomenal quarter, but investors aren't in the mood to savor the gains.

title: Your Covid Gray Hair? It's Here to Stay
summary: People are dropping the dye and embracing silver beards and roots. Reactions vary; 'confusing me with the Unabomber'. At the start of lockdowns, separated from their hairdressers and the rest of the world, many decided to seize the moment and finally go gray, women's hair and men's beards alike. It's now five months and several inches later, and something radical is happening. People are embracing their new look, awkward roots and all.

title: Lowe's Online Quarterly Sales More Than Doubled
summary: Sales at stores open at least a year rose 35.1% in the U.S. as consumers shopped for home projects during the pandemic. Lowe's Cos . posted surging sales for the May-to-July quarter, joining a group of large retailers that have benefited from shifting consumer spending patterns during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: The Left Still Blames America First
summary: But they've broadened the target. In 1984 it was U.S. foreign policy. Today it's the country itself.. Jeane Kirkpatrick delivered one of the most electrifying political convention speeches in American history to Republicans gathered in Dallas on Aug. 20, 1984. Its theme was that the left wing of the Democratic Party had fallen into the habit of "blaming America first" for the nation's foreign policy challenges. A Georgetown political scientist, a longtime Democrat and then-U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, Kirkpatrick hit the point repeatedly and hard. Whether the issue was Soviet aggression, Iranian theocracy or relations with our allies, she argued, the answer from the left was always the same: more unproductive criticism of America.

title: Activism Is for Adults
summary: Pressuring children into political activity is akin to recruiting them as soldiers.. When the post-Parkland walkouts occurred two years ago, I pleaded with my twins' private middle school not to participate in a divisive partisan exercise. I pay tuition for them to be educated, not enlisted. Wouldn't it have been more appropriate to host an after-school discussion on gun policy and teach students what everyone was yelling about, rather than encourage them to join the yelling?

title: Johnson & Johnson to Buy Momenta Pharmaceuticals for $6.5 Billion
summary: Deal gives J&J a foothold in a new class of drugs that aim to treat autoimmune diseases. Johnson & Johnson said Wednesday it agreed to buy drugmaker Momenta Pharmaceuticals Inc. for about $6.5 billion, giving J&J entry into a potentially big-selling new class of drugs to treat certain autoimmune diseases.

title: Democrats' Virtual Convention Means Comfort, Convenience and Inclusion
summary: The phrase 'less than ideal' keeps coming up in interviews with convention participants and viewers, but it looks slickly produced and no one feels left out.. Standing between a lectern and a wall of firewood at a Burlington, Vt., restaurant, Sen. Bernie Sanders had a pressing question before going live to deliver his address to the Democratic National Convention.

title: Trudeau Says He Initially Balked at Contract Award
summary: Canadian prime minister gives rare testimony before parliamentary hearing on fund with ties to family. OTTAWA-In a bid to defuse a weekslong controversy, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said Thursday he initially challenged government officials when they recommended awarding a lucrative government contract to a charity with financial ties to his family.

title: Nintendo's 'Animal Crossing' Goes Upscale With Museum Masterpieces
summary: When the pandemic hit, rappers and rock stars transformed videogames into virtual entertainment venues. Now, art museums-from the Met to the Getty-want to play.. The J. Paul Getty Museum has been closed since March, but that hasn't stopped Rachel Emmer from taking a few paintings from its collection to bolster her own, virtually.

title: Biotech Is Priced for Bad Reactions
summary: A pair of surprise FDA drug rejections has some biotech investors licking their wounds. Biotech investors just received two painful reminders of an old truth: There are no guarantees in drug development.

title: A $60 Million Orange County Mansion Could Break the Area's Price Record
summary: If the property on Laguna Beach's Abalone Point sells for its ask, it would top a $55 million deal in 2017. A mansion on Laguna Beach's Abalone Point, an exclusive community sitting on a peninsula that juts into the Pacific Ocean, is coming to market for $60 million. If it sells for that price, the home would be the most expensive residential property ever sold in California's Orange County, according to listing agent Andy Stavros of Douglas Elliman.

title: A Massive Mansion Overlooking the Pacific
summary: On Laguna Beach's Abalone Point, this 13,000-square-foot home sits on a peninsula that juts into the ocean.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Gidget Made This Malibu Surf Spot Famous. Not Much Has Changed.
summary: The teen wave-seeker and her friends gravitated to the Malibu Wall at Surfrider Beach. It's still hallowed ground for surfers, even if they drive nicer cars now.. The Malibu Wall dates back to 1929. It was erected on a coastal strip just north of Los Angeles as part of the perimeter of the Adamson House. The estate-built for the daughter of Malibu's last owner, back when the entire area was a ranch-made liberal use of Spanish Revival design details, right down to the red tile and turrets that topped its sea-facing gray brick wall. By the summer of 1957, when 16-year-old Kathy Kohner, nicknamed Gidget, began dragging her surfboard across Malibu's Surfrider Beach, and leaning it against that very wall, the beach had become a magnet for the nascent surfer crowd. They came to ride First Point, just off shore, one of the world's best breaks. Gidget was the rare surfer girl back then. She kept a diary of her sunny summer antics and shared entries with her father, screenwriter Frederick Kohner, a Czech Jew émigré. In just six weeks, Frederick penned the book "Gidget: The Little Girl with Big Ideas." Soon came Gidget movies and a TV series, the beach-party film genre, surf music and a national surf craze.

title: Colleges Scramble to Contain Coronavirus as They Open Campuses
summary: The University of Notre Dame and Michigan State University are the latest schools to change plans. Several large colleges have canceled in-person classes after a surge of coronavirus cases on campuses. The University of Notre Dame and Carnegie Mellon University are the latest schools to move classes online temporarily. The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill has already shifted all classes online after 130 students tested positive for Covid-19, while Michigan State University and Ithaca College asked students not to come to campus. But the virus may not just be spreading in classes: At Notre Dame, the spate of cases is linked to at least two off-campus parties.

title: Intellectual-Property Assets Are Getting More Valuable
summary: Covid-19 highlights importance of intellectual-property assets, particularly what happens with licensing contracts if a company goes out of business. Intellectual-property assets such as brand names, customer data and trademarks are gaining value as the Covid-19 pandemic upends traditional models for retailers, restaurants and other struggling businesses.

title: U.S.-China Trade Talks Delayed, Not Derailed
summary: Negotiators plan to confer by video in the coming days over progress in fulfilling terms of the 'Phase One' deal. U.S. and Chinese trade negotiators plan to confer by video in the coming days over progress in fulfilling terms of the "Phase One" trade deal and U.S. actions against Chinese technology firms, according to officials in both nations.

title: Chris Froome Left Off Tour de France Squad
summary: The four-time champion will instead make the Vuelta a Espana his final Grand Tour for Team Ineos. PARIS-The greatest cycling career of the 21st century took a dramatic turn last summer when Chris Froome pulled a move he had managed a million times before. He tried to blow his nose.

title: The Maker of the Taser Won't Be Defunded
summary: Axon Enterprise has moved beyond the stun gun and is now focused on collecting evidence from body cameras to keep police accountable. For Taser-maker Axon Enterprise, calls to "defund the police" could ultimately fund a lot of business.

title: DNC Guide: Joe Biden's Speech, Schedule, Speakers and How to Watch
summary: This year's DNC is virtual because of the coronavirus pandemic. This year's Democratic National Convention, which was originally set to take place in Milwaukee, Wis., instead is a virtual one due to the coronavirus pandemic. Joe Biden will accept the party's nomination remotely Thursday evening from the Chase Center in his home town of Wilmington, Del.

title: Maersk Quarterly Profit Triples on Rising Freight Rates, Falling Costs
summary: Capacity cuts and lower fuel costs helped the world's biggest container line offset falling shipping demand. Taking container ships out of service is proving profitable for A.P. Moeller-Maersk A/S.

title: Covid-19 Appeared to Be Under Control in Europe. Now It's Surging Again.
summary: Authorities want to avoid broad lockdowns and economic damage with narrower curbs. Coronavirus infections are surging again across much of Europe and governments are racing to prevent a full-fledged second wave of the pandemic -without resorting to the kind of broad lockdowns that devastated their economies in the spring.

title: Why Republicans Are Speaking at the Democratic Convention
summary: Giving Republicans prominent speaking slots is part of a broad-and potentially difficult-effort to lure disaffected GOP voters into supporting Joe Biden. The first night of the Democratic National Convention saw former Ohio Gov. John Kasich, who just four years ago sought the Republican presidential nomination, making the case for Joe Biden's candidacy.

title: Joe Biden United the Democrats-It's Not Likely to Last
summary: Resume Subscription. WILMINGTON, Del.-Former Vice President Joe Biden has united disparate factions of the Democratic Party behind a message of defeating President Trump and rebuilding from the coronavirus pandemic. The detente might not last past the Nov. 3 election, no matter who wins.

title: Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts Is Pivot in Coronavirus Cases
summary: Chief Justice Roberts's approach has followed a deference to local, state and federal authorities against legal challenges. WASHINGTON-Just as he was during the Supreme Court's term that ended in early July, Chief Justice John Roberts has emerged as the deciding vote when disputes over the coronavirus pandemic end up in court.

title: Fund Managers Say Bring On the Double Dip
summary: A survey of fund managers finds rising expectations for the economic recovery to be W-shaped. The letter of the month is...W.

title: In Baseball, Breaking Coronavirus Protocols Could Cost Millions
summary: The Cleveland Indians banished pitchers Zach Plesac and Mike Clevinger after they violated MLB's health rules by going out after a game. When Cleveland Indians pitchers Zach Plesac and Mike Clevinger sneaked out of the team's hotel in Chicago in violation of baseball's health protocols earlier this month, they risked exposing their co-workers to the coronavirus. In response, the Indians sent them home for a few days to quarantine.

title: Players Are Testing Positive for a 50-Year-Old Steroid. They Can't Explain Why.
summary: The players' association has proposed to MLB that a player's urine sample should register with at least 100 picograms per milliliter of DHCMT before the test counts as a positive. Houston Astros pitching prospect Kent Emanuel has known players who served suspensions for violating baseball's rules governing performance-enhancing drugs. They always swore they didn't do it, but Emanuel admits, "There was always that little seed of doubt in the back of my mind."

title: TikTok: Can the Over-30 Crowd Safely Ignore It?
summary: The micro-video platform is causing a national stir, but many see no reason to download the app in the first place. Are you missing out?. TikTok, a skyrocketing app favored by Gen Z and designed to showcase short-form mobile videos, has amassed 80 million active users in the U.S. Still, many in the 30-and-over crowd say they simply don't have the time or will for more social media. "That's stress I don't need in my life," said writer Louis Peitzman, 33, who has more than 68,000 Twitter followers. "Instagram is soul-sucking enough."

title: Premium Retailers Ride China's Recovery
summary: From autos to liquor, higher-end retailers are thriving as Chinese consumers bounce back. SHANGHAI-The coronavirus pandemic has created a divide in China's consumer economy, with makers of premium products rebounding strongly but those catering to mass-market consumers finding it tougher to return to growth.

title: Apps Serve Professionals Distanced Networking With Novel Twists
summary: Upstream, Lunchclub, Chalk and others are connecting homebound workers, some by capitalizing on Zoom-fatigue, while others flaunt exclusivity. A growing range of social networks for professionals are trying to capitalize on workers' continued confinement to their homes-and stand out in the shadow of Microsoft Corp.'s LinkedIn-by offering more sharply defined missions, faster contacts and unusual user experiences.

title: Character, National Security Dominate on Night Democrats Nominate Joe Biden
summary: Character and national security dominate on evening Democrats nominate Joe Biden. The second night of the Democratic National Convention served to officially nominate Joe Biden to compete against President Trump in November and also showcased a diverse new generation of Democratic up-and-comers.

title: Ross Spano Becomes Eighth House Lawmaker Defeated in Primaries
summary: The first-term Republican congressman faces a Justice Department investigation into campaign finances. WASHINGTON-Republican Rep. Ross Spano of Florida lost his re-election bid Tuesday night, the eighth House lawmaker to be defeated in a primary during this election cycle.

title: Gardening as a Radical Act
summary: "Gangsta gardener" Ron Finley, singer Kelis Rogers, farmer Leah Penniman and artist Linda Goode Bryant discuss finding freedom in growing their own food.. Linda Goode Bryant will be the first to tell you she didn't know much about farming when she decided to open a community garden in Brooklyn, New York back in 2009.

title: The Latest Project to Preserve Pompeii Reveals New Treasures
summary: Ancient frescoes, jewelry and a Greco-Roman god are among the unexpected discoveries archeologists made during a renovation effort to shore up Italy's ancient city of Pompeii. The mainly Italian tourists visiting the ruins of Italy's ancient city of Pompeii are getting a rare chance to see the site without the usual crowds-and admire spectacular finds unearthed during a six-year conservation project that is just now drawing to a close.

title: Damian Lillard Is the Longest Shot in the NBA
summary: The star of the NBA bubble takes and makes more shots from 30 to 40 feet than any team. The deep 3-pointer is Lillard's basketball superpower.. Phil Beckner carries a small bag with some basic necessities whenever and wherever he travels with Damian Lillard. Inside are the basketball and the pump that he brings everywhere. But only for Lillard does he throw in a tape measure and roll of painter's tape.

title: Berlin Highway Crash Is Investigated as a Terrorist Attack
summary: Police said an Iraqi-born suspect was detained Tuesday night after ramming his car into traffic. BERLIN-A series of apparently deliberate crashes on a Berlin highway Tuesday night is being treated as a possible Islamist terrorist attack, German police and prosecutors said Wednesday.

title: Good Grounds for American Exceptionalism in Stocks
summary: Investors might be surprised that equities are rebounding to record highs despite the coronavirus pandemic. But based on countries' economic policies, it's no surprise the U.S. got there first.. The S&P 500 is back at an all-time high. Explaining that to someone in the depths of the March selloff would have been difficult, but there are good reasons that the U.S. has been the first major market to mark new records.

title: Purses Are Out. Fanny Packs Are In.
summary: With practically nowhere to go and little to carry, women are trading cumbersome bags for hands-free designer fanny packs, ideal for toting masks, phones and hand sanitizer. ONE STAINED face mask was all it took for me to quit my beloved lipstick, and I've traded in my monthly hair-dye appointments for my natural, Susan Sontag-ish gray streak. My transformation into a Covid-era creature did not reach completion, however, until I strapped on my new fanny pack.

title: NIH Presses U.S. Nonprofit for Information on Wuhan Virology Lab
summary: National Institutes of Health told EcoHealth Alliance it must hand over information and materials from Chinese research facility to resume funding for suspended grant. The National Institutes of Health told a small New York-based nonprofit that it must hand over information and materials from a research partner in Wuhan, China, that is under scrutiny by the Trump administration to win back a multimillion-dollar research grant.

title: Some States Are Pushing Laws to Restrict Police Behavior
summary: Spurred by George Floyd protests, Democratic lawmakers debate whether to facilitate suing law-enforcement officers, government officials. Democratic legislators in states across the country are trying to advance legislation that would subject law-enforcement officers to more legal liability for misconduct and restrict their use of force.

title: China's National-Security Law Makes Top U.S. Colleges Wary
summary: Professors at elite U.S. universities turn to code names, warning labels to protect students. The effect of the new national-security law that China imposed on Hong Kong is extending far beyond the territory to American college campuses.

title: Coronavirus Pandemic Slashes Donations of Lifesaving Plasma
summary: The decline is worrying for patients with illnesses like immune disorders and cancer who use plasma-derived therapies. SYDNEY-Collections of blood plasma have fallen sharply in recent months because of the coronavirus pandemic, raising worries about the supply of important medicines that rely on it.

title: Soldiers Detain Mali Leaders in Apparent Coup Attempt
summary: President Ibrahim Boubacar Keita announces resignation. JOHANNESBURG-Mali's president resigned after renegade soldiers had detained him, the prime minister and dozens of other senior officials in what appeared to be a coup attempt following months of antigovernment demonstrations.

title: Covid-19 Mystery: How Did the Coronavirus Return to New Zealand?
summary: Authorities have traced the virus to a worker in a cold-storage warehouse, but they can't figure out how he got it. New Zealand authorities traced the first reappearance of coronavirus in the country after three long months to a man in his 50s who worked at a cold-storage warehouse in Auckland.

title: Regeneron Enlists Swiss Rival to Help Make Covid-19 Drug
summary: Roche will help manufacture and distribute Regeneron's promising Covid-19 antibody medicine, more than tripling expected supply. Roche Holding AG has agreed to help manufacture and distribute a promising investigational drug for Covid-19 being developed by Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc., a pairing of rivals that could more than triple supplies of the medicine if it is authorized by regulators, the companies said Wednesday.

title: Democrats Nominate Joe Biden to Lead Nation Through Pandemic
summary: Jill Biden touts her husband's character; Bill Clinton, Colin Powell criticize President Trump's record. Democrats formally made Joe Biden their presidential nominee, a role he has sought for more than three decades, capping a come-from-behind victory in the primaries he secured with a broad coalition of his party's voters.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: The Trump Campaign Is Suing New Jersey
summary: The governor's vote-by-mail executive order is unconstitutional.. Democratic convention speakers have been peddling the conspiracy theory that President Trump is working to "sabotage" the U.S. Postal Service. Mr. Trump is working to fix longstanding USPS problems, and the complaints are a distraction from the Democrats' radical proposal for a universal vote-by-mail system, which the president has rightly said is riddled with chaos and fraud.

title: Notre Dame, Michigan State Act to Slow Spread of Virus
summary: Both schools cite need for restrictions as cases rise; Notre Dame cancels in-person classes as Michigan State asks students to stay home. The University of Notre Dame and Michigan State University on Tuesday both announced moves designed to slow the spread of the coronavirus on their campuses.

title: Trump Expresses Support for Oracle to Buy TikTok
summary: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison is Trump supporter, hosted fundraiser for the president. President Trump voiced support on Tuesday for Oracle Corp. to buy the U.S. operations of TikTok, adding a fresh wrinkle to the bidding for the Chinese-owned video-sharing app.

title: How to Handle a Jerk
summary: Stress may be bringing out more obnoxious, self-absorbed behavior. What can you do when you encounter it?. Dear Bonds,

title: Trump Pardons Susan B. Anthony as Nation Marks 19th Amendment's Centennial
summary: Decision comes amid the president's push for support from women during his re-election campaign. President Trump on Tuesday pardoned Susan B. Anthony, who fought for a woman's right to vote, on the 100th anniversary of the ratification of the 19th Amendment.
